title: Hotel raid for Sewwandi leads to surprise bust
byline: Police carried out a raid on a hotel in Anuradhapura town on information that the absconding suspect Ishara Sewwandi wanted in connection with the murder of Ganemulle Sanjeewa was staying at the hotel, to find that it was a misidentification, but arrested the woman with similar countenance of Ishara Sewwandi and a former Army Major in her company who had in their possession a stock of illegal intoxicants.

title: Volcano erupts in Iceland, triggering tourist evacuation
byline: A volcano erupted to the south of Iceland’s capital on Tuesday (April 1), spewing lava and smoke in a fiery display of orange and red that triggered the evacuation of tourists and residents, although air traffic continued as normal.

title: Doctor allegedly pushed wife off Hawaii trail after she refused to take photo with him
byline: A doctor in Hawaii is accused of trying to kill his wife after she allegedly refused to take a picture with him, according to authorities.

title: Indian advanced security team arrives ahead of Modi’s visit
byline: An advanced security team from India has arrived in Colombo to coordinate with Sri Lankan security agencies ahead of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Sri Lanka this week, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Overwhelming response to new sperm bank
byline: The newly established sperm bank at Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo has already assisted six women, offering new hope to those struggling with infertility.

title: ‘Diesel Mafia’ looms over  Sri Lanka’s solar power sector again
byline: The Federation of Renewable Energy Developers (FRED) Sri Lanka yesterday raised serious concerns about a resurgence of the ‘diesel mafia’, accusing it of systematically moving to cause a natural death to the country’s solar power sector.

title: Court further suspends election activities in nomination-disputed LG institutions
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the relevant returning officers to further suspend election activities until tomorrow (03) in local government institutions where political parties and independent groups have filed petitions challenging the rejection of nomination papers.

title: Putin begins biggest Russian military call-up in years
byline: President Vladimir Putin has called up 160,000 men aged 18-30, Russia’s highest number of conscripts since 2011, as the country moves to expand the size of its military.

title: COPE to take Gem and Jewellery Authority before Bribery Commission
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprise (COPE) is to file a complaint against the Gem and Jewellery Authority for allowing illegal gem mining, it was reported yesterday.

title: Labour Ministry to raise private sector minimum salary to Rs. 27,000
byline: The Labour Ministry has announced plans to amend the law to raise the monthly minimum salary for private sector employees to Rs. 27,000.

title: Batman actor Val Kilmer dies aged 65
byline: Hollywood actor Val Kilmer, known for his roles in hit films including Top Gun and Batman Forever, has died aged 65.

title: Forbes World’s Billionaires list 2025: The top 200
byline: Elon Musk has regained his position as the world’s richest individual on Forbes’ annual billionaires list, despite facing some financial challenges and criticism for his involvement with the Trump administration.

title: Cory Booker breaks record for longest Senate speech after 24 hours
byline: US Senator Cory Booker has broken the record for the longest speech ever delivered in the Senate.

title: Ex-North-Central CM, secretary sentenced to 16 years RI for corruption
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Aditya Patabendi today sentenced former North Central Province Chief Minister S.M. Ranjith and his private secretary Shanthi Chandrasena — the spouse of former Minister S.M. Chandrasena — to 16 years of rigorous imprisonment after being found guilty of corruption charges.

title: Volcano erupts in Iceland, triggering tourist evacuation
byline: A volcano erupted to the south of Iceland’s capital on Tuesday (April 1), spewing lava and smoke in a fiery display of orange and red that triggered the evacuation of tourists and residents, although air traffic continued as normal.

title: New Chairman, members appointed to Sri Lanka Press Council
byline: A new Chairman and three members have been appointed to the Board of Directors of the Sri Lanka Press Council by the Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Immigration regional office to be established for Northern Province
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to establish a regional office of the Department of Immigration and Emigration in Vavuniya, Northern Province, where several districts of Sri Lanka are located.

title: Sri Lanka engages US to follow due procedure
byline: In the wake of four Sri Lankans being deported after they were caught in their attempt to cross the border into the United States, Sri Lanka is now in contact with the US authorities to make sure that the procedure laid down in the Extradition Treaty and mechanisms outlined in other laws between the two countries are followed in case any Sri Lankan is sought to be deported under the migration policy of the Trump administration in the future...

title: HC upholds first-ever conviction over illegal pyramid scheme in Sri Lanka
byline: The Anuradhapura High Court upheld the first-ever conviction in Sri Lanka related to an illegal pyramid scheme, affirming the decision of the Magistrate’s Court to convict two Development Officers of the Department of Agriculture Research.

title: Rajangana Saddharathna Thera warned to refrain from using obscene language
byline: The Fort Magistrate today issued a warning to Rajangana Saddharathna Thera, instructing him to refrain from using obscene and indecent language in his public speeches.

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly passes unanimous resolution to retrieve Katchatheevu island
byline: The Tamil Nadu Assembly unanimously passed a resolution urging the Union government to take steps to retrieve Katchatheevu Island from Sri Lanka. Opposition parties of AIADMK and the BJP also supported the motion.

title: Special committee to assess implications of UK sanctions
byline: The government has appointed a special committee to assess the implications of the United Kingdom’s recent sanctions on four Sri Lankan individuals and recommend further action.

title: Sri Lanka pledges $1 Mn in aid for Myanmar
byline: Sri Lanka has pledged $1 million in humanitarian aid to support Myanmar’s earthquake relief and recovery efforts, Deputy Foreign Minister Arun Hemachandra said.

title: Government mulls rice imports to ensure supply
byline: The Food Policy and Security Committee has recommended the importation of rice in the near future to ensure an uninterrupted supply for consumers.
